newsitem.title: USA: BTG gets covenant waivers from lenders.
newsitem.headline: BTG gets covenant waivers from lenders.

text.p: BTG Inc said Wednesday it has obtained waivers from certain convenants in loan agreements with its lenders, following its incurring a net loss of $481,000 or $0.05 a share, for the fourth quarter ended March 31.
In a statement, the information technology products and services company said that the net loss had put it out of compliance of certain loan agreement covenants.
It did not specify what those covenants were.
In the statement, Edward Bersoff, president and chief executive officer of the company, expressed disappointment over the fourth-quarter results, which he said were due to unexpected events.
He said those events included cost pressures related to the company's rapid expansion, increased costs of investment in current projects and one-time charges.

He said the one-time charges included higher than expected costs of consolidating Washington-area facilities, a client's bankruptcy and an increase in reserves associated with other commercial business.
